docs.lead_paragraph: Medicis Pharmaceutical, which makes prescription treatments for people who cannot stand their wrinkles, has agreed to acquire Inamed, a rival better known as the market leader in breast implants for women. The deal, for stock and cash, is valued at $2.8 billion. The two companies told analysts in a conference call yesterday that they expected the deal to create an ''aesthetics powerhouse'' able to meet expanding demand for products to preserve a youthful appearance.

headline.main: Maker of Wrinkle Treatment To Buy Breast Implant Leader

docs.abstract: Medicis Pharmaceutical agrees to acquire Inamed, market leader in breast implants for women, in deal valued at $2.8 billion (M)
docs.snippet: Medicis Pharmaceutical, which makes prescription treatments for people who cannot stand their wrinkles, has agreed to acquire Inamed, a rival better known as the market leader in breast implants for women. The deal, for stock and cash, is valued at...

docs.lead_paragraph: Even though diseases as serious as SARS and tuberculosis have been spread on airline flights, the air in a jetliner is probably no more likely to carry infections than most other closely confined spaces, a review of studies has found. The report appears in the March 12 issue of Lancet.

headline.main: No Flier Miles for Airborne Germs

docs.abstract: Dr Mark A Gendreau, Burlington, Mass, emergency medicine specialist, leads study on risk of catching illness while flying; research, which is published in Lancet, finds there is no more risk of becoming sick on plane than in average office building (S)
docs.snippet: Even though diseases as serious as SARS and tuberculosis have been spread on airline flights, the air in a jetliner is probably no more likely to carry infections than most other closely confined spaces, a review of studies has found.
